# galah

[{galah}](https://galah.ala.org.au/) is an R and Python interface to biodiversity data hosted by the Atlas of Living Australia (ALA). It enables users to locate and download species occurrence records (observations, specimens, eDNA records, etc.), taxonomic information, or associated media such as images or sounds, and to restrict their queries to particular taxa or locations.<br> <br>
Visit the **[{galah} website](http://galah.ala.org.au/)** to learn more.<br><br>
If you have any questions, comments, or spot any bugs, [email us](mailto:support@ala.org.au) or report an issue on the [R package GitHub page](https://github.com/AtlasOfLivingAustralia/galah-R) or the [Python package Github page](https://github.com/AtlasOfLivingAustralia/galah-python)

:::

# corella

[{corella}](https://corella.ala.org.au/) is an R and Python package that helps users standardize their data using the [Darwin Core](https://dwc.tdwg.org/) data standard, used for biodiversity data like species occurrences. corella provides tools to prepare, manipulate and validate data against the standard’s criteria. Once standardized, data can be subsequently shared as a [Darwin Core Archive](https://ipt.gbif.org/manual/en/ipt/latest/dwca-guide#what-is-darwin-core-archive-dwc-a) and published to open data infrastructures like the [Atlas of Living Australia](https://www.ala.org.au/) and [GBIF](https://www.gbif.org/).<br> <br>
Visit the **[{corella} website](https://corella.ala.org.au/)** to learn more.<br><br>
If you have any questions, comments, or spot any bugs, [email us](mailto:support@ala.org.au) or report an issue on the [R package GitHub page](https://github.com/AtlasOfLivingAustralia/corella) or the [Python package Github page](https://github.com/AtlasOfLivingAustralia/corella-python)

:::

# delma

[{delma}](https://delma.ala.org.au/) is an R package for converting metadata statements written in R Markdown or Quarto markdown to [Ecological Metadata Language](https://eml.ecoinformatics.org/) (EML). EML is a common framework for describing ecological datasets so they can be shared and reused. delma supports users to write metadata statements in R Markdown or Quarto markdown for greater transparency and ease-of-use, then convert them to EML for efficient transfer.<br> <br>
Visit the **[{delma} website](https://delma.ala.org.au/)** to learn more.<br><br>
If you have any questions, comments, or spot any bugs, [email us](mailto:support@ala.org.au) or report an issue on the [R package GitHub page](https://github.com/AtlasOfLivingAustralia/delma) or the [Python package Github page](https://github.com/AtlasOfLivingAustralia/delma-python)

:::

# potions

[{potions}](https://potions.ala.org.au/) makes options management in R—usually edited using `base::options()` and related functions—simpler. It uses a minimalist workflow to store and retrieve information with three core functions: `brew()`, `pour()` and `drain()`.<br> <br>
Visit the **[{potions} website](https://potions.ala.org.au/)** to learn more about how to use {potions}<br><br>
If you have any questions, comments, or spot any bugs, [email us](mailto:support@ala.org.au) or [report an issue](https://github.com/AtlasOfLivingAustralia/potions) on our GitHub page

:::
